title: Ticket #7432: Job router should use a list of job transforms for the route
description:
The JobRouter should use the same configuration model and syntax for routes that the schedd does for JOB_TRANSFORMs

This is a follow-on to work to apply the routes in the order in which they are declared.

There will be new knobs

  • JOB_ROUTER_PRE_ROUTE_TRANSFORM_NAMES a list of transforms that will be applied in order when an incoming job matches a route but before the routing transform is applied.
  • JOB_ROUTER_POST_ROUTE_TRANSFORM_NAMES a list of transforms that will be applied in order after a route transform is applied

Names in these two knobs will refer to pre-and post route transforms defined by JOB_ROUTER_TRANSFORM_<name> knobs. These knobs will allow, but not require REQUIREMENTS statements, so that not all pre/post route transforms need be applied to all jobs that are routed.

There will be a new knob JOB_ROUTER_USE_DEPRECATED_ROUTER_ENTRIES that will default to true for now, but will be set to false some time in the future. When this knob is false, the JobRouter will longer parse the 3 JOB_ROUTER_ENTRIES* knobs and the JOB_ROUTER_DEFAULTS knob, and will generate a warning if any of these are configured.

Google doc for job router config redesign: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1IkEV907Jsc2Wu6HIhhrH9QdFTiGkFzuUn5CTVPRZzNs/edit?usp=sharing
